photos.alt: Turquoise-browed motmot (Eumomota superciliosa) | Guanacaste, Costa Rica
photos.description: The Turquoise-browed Motmot is known for its stunning colors and distinctive racket-shaped tail.

photos.alt: Rufous-naped wren (Campylorhynchus rufinucha) | Guanacaste, Costa Rica
photos.description: Rufous-naped Wrens are large, social wrens found in Central America.
Northern Flickers are woodpeckers with distinctive spotted plumage and bright yellow shaft feathers.
Downy Woodpeckers are the smallest woodpeckers in North America.
Belted Kingfishers are striking birds with their slate blue coloration and impressive crest.
Wood Ducks are often considered the most beautiful waterfowl in North America.
American Goldfinches are bright spots of color in summer.
The Rose-breasted Grosbeak is a stunning bird with its black and white plumage.
